title: Baseband L1 Software Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**Are you our next newly graduated software engineer to build the future of 5G and 6G?**  

  

**About this opportunity**

  

Are you passionate about cutting-edge technology and ready to launch your career at the forefront of 5G and beyond?  

  

We are looking for newly graduated software engineers to join our Baseband Software L1 Development team in Kista. At Ericsson, you’ll step into an exciting environment where innovation, collaboration, and growth go hand in hand. You’ll be working with state-of-the-art technologies, shaping the physical layer software that powers our world-leading 5G Radio Access Network—and soon, 6G.  

  

When you join our team, you’ll be surrounded by skilled mentors, supportive colleagues, and a shared drive to explore, learn, and make a difference.

 **What you will do**

 **As a member of the L1 team, you will be part of developing the Physical Layer (L1) components of Ericsson’s Baseband software—core building blocks of our world-leading 5G RAN and future 6G solutions.**

 **What You'll do :**

* Collaborate with engineers to design, develop, and maintain core software components, supporting the full development lifecycle from initial study to verification.
* Enhance existing features and develop new ones, with a focus on performance, scalability, and reliability—leveraging Ericsson’s evolving Multi-Core Architecture Platform.
* Participate in code reviews, testing, and quality assurance activities.
* Troubleshoot and resolve software issues to ensure seamless operation.
* Get hands-on experience with real products and projects, applying your academic knowledge in a meaningful, challenging context.
* Learn industry best practices, agile ways of working, and state-of-the-art development environments applying new knowledge to improve product innovation.
 **Skills you bring:**

* A Master’s degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Wireless Communications, Electrical/Electronic Engineering, or a related field.
* Strong foundation in embedded systems, real-time software, and C/C++ programming.
* A collaborative mindset, eagerness to learn, and the courage to take initiative and ownership.
* A passion for technology, innovation, and making a real impact.
* Curiosity and resilience to tackle complex problems—and a willingness to grow through challenges.
* Familiarity with Wireless communication technologies (4G/5G), 3GPP/ORAN standards, and/or signal processing is a strong plus.
* Experience with real-time operating systems, multi-core architectures, or DSP programming is very good to have.

title: Developer HW Methods & Tools
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


As a CAD Tool Administrator & Developer, you will play a key role in supporting and enhancing the use of our CAD tools. You will be responsible for administering, maintaining, and developing features to optimize our CAD systems, ensuring smooth integration into engineering workflows. This role will give you exposure to both the technical aspects of CAD tools and the opportunity to collaborate with engineers across multiple departments and tool suppliers.

 **What you will do:**

* Administer and maintain our CAD tools, including troubleshooting issues, updating software, and ensuring that all users have the appropriate access and permissions.
* Develop and implement custom scripts and automation processes to enhance CAD tool functionality and improve workflow efficiency.
* Provide technical support and training to engineering teams on the effective use of CAD tools.
* Collaborate with engineering teams to identify opportunities for tool optimization and workflow improvements.
* Monitor and resolve system performance issues, ensuring minimal disruption to project timelines.
* Contribute to the integration of CAD tools with other engineering software, including PLM and ERP systems.

 **The skills you bring:**

* A degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Familiarity with CAD software (such as AutoCAD, SolidWorks, CATIA, or similar) and their administration.
* Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, VBA, or JavaScript) to develop custom solutions and automation.
* Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
* Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to collaborate across departments.
* A keen interest in software development, systems administration, and engineering technologies.
* Self-motivated, with the ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks efficiently.

 **Preferred Qualifications:**  

* Experience with CAD system administration, especially in an engineering environment.
* Familiarity with PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) or ERP systems.
* Knowledge of version control tools (e.g., Git).
* Understanding of database management and SQL.
 **Why Join Us?**  

* Gain hands-on experience with leading-edge CAD technologies and software development.
* Work in a collaborative and innovative environment where your ideas and contributions matter.
* Opportunity to grow within a fast-paced, forward-thinking company.
* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Professional development opportunities and mentorship from experienced engineers.

This is an exciting opportunity for a recent graduate or someone early in their career to gain hands-on experience in the world of CAD software and engineering technology.

**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

title: Software Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
 We are looking for a software developer with experience in embedded systems and software, preferably within the automotive industry.
   

  

 The most important experience and/or knowledge is the ability to develop embedded systems and software, in order to understand the challenges faced by the users you will be supporting – as well as being able to describe and insert these items (embedded systems and software) into the PDM/PLM system.
   

  

 Our idea is that a suitable candidate is either an embedded systems and software developer who wants to take on a supporting/mentoring role, or a technical writer or IT business analyst with previous experience in developing embedded systems and software.
   

  

**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Experience with Embedded Software and Hardware development,
* Knowledge about:
* Product Data Management (PDM) Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) system
* Electrical system and/or embedded systems in vehicles.
* Master of Science, (other level of education is also acceptable if proven track record of work can match the education level),
* Scaled Agile Framework,
* Leadership skills


 English on a professional level (Swedish is beneficial).
   

  

**Application deadline:** 
 25-04-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.

title: Freelance Software Developer (JavaScript) - AI Tutor
description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.
   

  

**What We Do**
 The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.
   

  

**About The Role**
 GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.
   

  

 Although every project is unique, you might typically:
   

  

* Generate prompts that challenge AI
* Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
* Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge


**How To Get Started**
 Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.
   

  

**Requirements**
* You have a Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
* You have at least 3 years of professional experience with JavaScript
* Code review experience is a must
* Experience with AI projects is a plus
* Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
* You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
* Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


**Benefits**
**Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?**
* Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
* Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
* Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

title: Web Developer
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

**Our mission is great open source**
 It is our mission to make open source software available to people everywhere. We create world-renowned software, impacting the lives of millions of people every day.
   

  

 The web team works in a multi-disciplinary environment with visual designers, UX designers and other developers to bring exciting new web projects to life. We help and learn from each other and constantly strive to improve both our work and our processes.
   

  

**Required skills and experience**
* Demonstrable experience of work on modern web applications
* A strong understanding of HTML, CSS with SCSS and JavaScript
* Experience with Javascript components libraries
* Experience with TypeScript
* Experience with responsive user interfaces for a wide range of devices and browsers
* Experience with Git or other version control systems
* Awareness of SEO best practice
* Consideration of accessibility in all aspects of your work
* A strong understanding of web performance in complex user interfaces
* Ability to interact with UX, designers and server-side developers
* Curiosity about technology and a thirst to learn
* Based in EMEA timezones (Europe, the Middle East and Africa)
* University degree or equivalent education


**Useful experience if you have it**
* Familiarity with Linux desktop technologies
* Server-side languages, such as Python or NodeJS
* Experience working on a large scale React (with TypeScript) project
* A history of open source contributions
* Relevant work experience


**Who you are**
 We want a Web Developer who loves what they do. You are passionate about web standards and keep abreast of new developments in our industry. You always look for opportunities to improve your skills. You like to show off what you're working on and also learn from others. You have strong attention to detail and value the design of a product as much as you value the code. You have strong communication skills and maybe even blog once in a while. You're aware of the latest CSS techniques but also know the limitations that developing for a broad audience can bring - actually, you embrace the challenge.
   

  

**In this team**
* You'll create high fidelity websites and web apps using the latest incarnations of HTML, CSS (SCSS) and Javascript (React and TypeScript)
* You'll help maintain existing projects including updating content and adding new pages
* You'll manage incoming requests for updates and liaise with or delegate to other people as necessary
* You'll ensure the standard of our output remains high and consistent across our whole product portfolio
* You'll ensure new pages are published according to specification and in compliance with our web style guide
* You'll participate in and contribute to our living style guide, Vanilla Framework.
* Work closely with UX designers and visual designers to implement exemplary user experiences.


**What we offer colleagues**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Backend Developer
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging the status quo in the property management industry. We're committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our cloud-based platform is unique, and we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player in a brief time. Our global product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
   

  

**About The Role**
 As we continue to experience significant growth, we are looking for a backend developer to join a team working with managed deposits, bank integrations and payments. You will have the opportunity to shape the product as part of a cross-functional team, where your decision making skills and expertise will be highly valued.
   

  

 You’ll join a team working across two technology platforms: our Java-based system for managed deposits and our PHP platform for property management. The Java platform manages B2B transactions with banking partners through APIs and backend services built on Java 17, Spring Boot, and Dropwizard, with a UI built in Vaadin. This system runs in containerized Linux environment, and is deployed via GitHub workflows and monitored with Prometheus and Grafana. While your primary focus will be on the Java stack, you’ll also contribute to our PHP platform. Strong Java skills are essential, and experience with PHP and the LAMP stack is highly valuable for this collaborative role.
   

  

 Our agile approach, along with our emphasis on close teamwork and communication, creates an environment where your contributions make a real impact. Collaboration and helping each other are integral to our culture, and you will play a key role in every aspect of the development process, from ideation to architecture to release. We work closely with our end users, gathering feedback that helps us continuously improve.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You thrive in a dynamic business environment that is constantly evolving, where you have the freedom to take initiative and implement your ideas. You strive for excellence in everything you do and always aim to deliver your best. You are not concerned with prestige and enjoy working in a collaborative team environment.
   

  

**Experience**
* 5+ years of professional experience in backend development using Java.
* Expertise in Spring Boot for building robust and scalable microservices.
* Experience in building and maintaining integrations to banking and payment systems is a plus.
* Experience with PHP is a plus.
* Proven experience working in a modern CI/CD pipeline.
* Proven experience in using docker and Linux.
* Solid understanding of RESTful APIs and experience with building and consuming APIs in a microservices environment.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in an Agile/Scrum environment.
* Experience in PropTech or FinTech sectors is a plus.
* Fluency in English is required, Swedish is a plus.


**What We Offer**
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development


**Location**
 Our office is on the top floor in the newly built Sthlm 04, which offers stunning views over Stockholm.
   

  

**Excited?**
 If you are excited about being part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position.
   

  

 👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo
   

  

 🔍 About Odevo
   

  

 🌐 Our Software

title: Dotnet Developer

 If this sounds like the kind of environment where you thrive, let’s talk.

title: Back End Developer
description:
We’re looking for an experienced Backend Developer to join our growing product team in Stockholm. This is an exciting opportunity to work at the core of a modern SaaS platform, contributing to scalable and high-performing backend systems built using Python and FastAPI. You'll play a key role in designing, building, and deploying backend services and infrastructure that power our platform, while working closely with a highly skilled and collaborative team.
 



  





**What You'll Be Doing:** 



* Develop, test and maintain robust backend systems using Python and FastAPI
* Architect and scale microservices in a cloud-native environment (GCP)
* Collaborate with frontend developers, product managers and DevOps engineers to deliver end-to-end features
* Build and maintain Docker-based development and deployment pipelines
* Help shape and improve CI/CD practices, monitoring, and infrastructure
* Participate in code reviews, design discussions and planning sessions
* Stay up to date with best practices in backend development and cloud infrastructure



**Must-Have Experience:** 



* 6+ years as a backend engineer, with strong Python expertise
* Hands-on experience with FastAPI in production environments
* Proficiency in cloud platforms, especially Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
* Strong understanding of Docker and containerized development workflows
* Experience working in a DevOps-influenced environment (CI/CD, monitoring, IaC, etc.)
* Solid understanding of system design, API development, and scalable architectures
* Comfortable working in a hybrid model – onsite 3 days per week in our Stockholm office



**Nice to Have:** 



* Familiarity with Kubernetes or other orchestration tools
* Background in SaaS product development
* Experience with relational and NoSQL databases
* Previous experience in cross-functional product teams

title: Software Developer 3
description:
**Job Description**
 The Java Platform Group is responsible for developing features and enhancements for the Java programming language. The Serviceability team within this group is responsible for developing features which make it easier to triage, troubleshoot, monitor and optimize Java applications. These features encompass a wide range of technologies including the JVM Tools Interface (JVMTI), Java Debugger Interface (JDI), Java Management Extensions (JMX), Serviceability Agent, Attach Framework, and a host of tools supporting JVM profiling, monitoring and management. We work closely with the Compiler, Runtime, and GC teams to collaborate on new feature design and development.
   

  

 Career Level - IC3
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**RESPONSIBILITIES**
 As a member of the Java Serviceability team, you will be responsible for the design and development of new Serviceability features and for ensuring quality across multiple Java release trains, working in collaboration with other internal Oracle teams and the OpenJDK community to provide support for emerging Java technologies. You will provide maintenance of current Serviceability features and design new features that help keep Java vibrant.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Functional knowledge of the Java language and of the JVM, including garbage collection mechanics, classloaders, byte-code instrumentation, and idiomatic Java programming
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering or the equivalent
* Strong hands-on design and development experience in Java development
* Experience in native development
* Experience in multi-platform development
* Experience in C/C++ coding
* Ability to create proof of concepts, code prototypes to showcase improvements.


**About Us**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s challenges. We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 We know that true innovation starts when everyone is empowered to contribute. That’s why we’re committed to growing an inclusive workforce that promotes opportunities for all.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer competitive benefits based on parity and consistency and support our people with flexible medical, life insurance, and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by emailing accommodation-request\_mb@oracle.com or by calling +1 888 404 2494 in the United States.
   

  

 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

title: Application Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* You have proficiency in Kotlin (5+ years).
* You have a strong understanding of object-oriented programming, design patterns, and exception handling.
* You have mastery of core APIs, such as collections, streams, and concurrency frameworks.
* You have knowledge of software architecture patterns like microservices and serverless architectures.
* You have the ability to design scalable and resilient systems, including databases and APIs.
* You are familiar with popular Java frameworks (Spring Boot, Hibernate).
* You have familiarity with Kotlin frameworks (Ktor).
* You have 3+ years proficiency in cloud services (preferably Azure).
* You have proficiency in containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes).
* You have experience with CI/CD pipelines.
* You have experience with monitoring and logging tools.
* You are a problem solver with great analytical thinking, collaboration and communication.
* You have the ability to troubleshoot and optimize backend systems.


**Application deadline:** 
 05-05-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Sr. Frontend Engineer for Portfolio Brands
description:
**Company Description**
 Portfolio Brands Engineering is part of Business Tech within H&M group and supports technical development for our Portfolio Brands -
 **COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, and ARKET** 
 . We are on a journey to implement the latest innovative solutions, offering seamless navigation, personalized recommendations, and an immersive browsing experience. We leverage advanced technologies to ensure a fast, secure, and user-friendly interface, allowing customers to explore our curated collections effortlessly. Our commitment to excellence drives us to continuously enhance our digital storefront and ensure that our customers experience an exceptional online shopping journey.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking a talented
 **Senior Frontend Developer** 
 to join our dynamic team. As a Senior Software Engineer, you are an experienced professional who leads complex projects, mentors junior team members, and contributes to the technical direction of our organization.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain high-quality responsive web applications, ensuring seamless user experiences through collaboration with cross-functional teams.
* Participate in code reviews, mentor junior developers, and foster a culture of continuous improvement and knowledge sharing within Communities of Practice (CoP).
* Contribute to architectural decisions and technical roadmap planning, ensuring alignment with business objectives and stakeholder needs.
* Help the team solve technical problems quickly and ensure engineering excellence through customer centricity, rigorous testing, innovative solutions, and adherence to best practices in software development.
* Work-in and follow Agile methodologies.
* Learn, grow, be challenged, and have fun!


**Qualifications**
* At least 5+ years' experience working as a software engineer with strong frontend focus.
* Applicable relevant qualification in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field.
* Extensive experience in front end development, particularly with React and Typescript. Experience with NextJs is a plus.
* Strong understanding of modern front-end architecture and best practices.
* Proficiency in front end build tools and package managers such as Webpack, Babel, or npm.
* Interest and experience in mentoring a team of developers.
* Collaborate with backend, data, analytics and designer teams to create seamless user experiences.
* Good knowledge of cloud platform CI/CD, Understanding of Github is must.
* Working in CMS tool is desired.
* Knowledge of tailwind is an advantage.
* Good to have knowledge of Nodejs.
* Knowledge of accessibility standards (WCAG, etc.) to build inclusive and compliant web applications.
* Staying updated on emerging technology trends like API strategy, event-driven architecture, and cloud computing to contribute effectively to evolving technology strategies.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and a keen eye for detail.
* Fluency in English as it is the working language at H&M Group.


**Additional Information**
 For this position, we are primarily looking for candidates located in and around the Stockholm region to work in our
 **office in Liljeholmen** 
 .
   

  

 Benefits at H&M Group:
   

  

* 6 weeks' time off yearly and good work-life balance.
* Special discount for our employees in all H&M stores and online worldwide.
* Collective Agreement and ITP pensions competitive to Swedish market.
* Lots of additional perks and discounts from Benify for health and wellbeing.
* Ample focus groups to celebrate diversity and inclusiveness as well as our international culture and events.


**Are you the person we are looking for?** 
 If your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with CV in English.

title: Solution Developer
description:
**Role:**

title: .Net Developer
company_industry: Civil Engineering, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
Är du en erfaren .Net-utvecklare med en passion för digital innovation och problemlösning? Då är ICA rätt plats för dig! Vi söker flera utvecklare som vill vara med och skapa banbrytande lösningar och optimera vår affärsverksamhet och vara en del av spännande projekt och möjligheter.
   

  

 Om rollen som .Net developer
   

  

 Som .Net-utvecklare på ICA kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att utveckla innovativa lösningar som förbättrar kund- och butikupplevelser och optimerar affärsverksamheten inom logistik och sortiment och inköp. Med hjälp av en mångsidig teknikstack, inklusive .Net/C#, Azure, mikrotjänster, CI/CD och frontend-verktyg som JavaScript, Vue, React och Svelte, kommer du att:
   

  

* Utveckla skalbara och användarvänliga cloud-native applikationer.
* Implementera robusta CI/CD-pipelines för att säkerställa smidiga distributioner.
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att leverera högkvalitativa lösningar som uppfyller affärsmål.


 Vem är du?
   

  

 Vi söker dig med stark grund i .Net/C# och en nyfikenhet på nya teknologier. Du har några års erfarenhet som utvecklare och tycker om att lösa problem självständigt men även i team. Du har stort intresse för utveckling liksom arkitektur och att bygga lösningar som du själv vill förvalta. Vi tror att du har:
   

  

* Omfattande erfarenhet av .Net utveckling
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla cloud-native lösningar, gärna med mikrotjänster arkitektur.
* Erfarenhet av förvaltning av databaser – både SQL- och dokumentdatabaser.
* Intresse för frontend-utveckling och tekniker som React, Javascript, TypeScript,
* Förmåga att kommunicera både på svenska och engelska.
* Det är meriterande med kunskap inom CI/CD och DevOps-praktiker


 Det är meriterande om du har en högskoleexamen inom datasystemvetenskap, programmering eller likvärdigt och/eller jobbat i eller mot dagligvaruhandel
   

  

 Vad händer nu?
   

  

 Om du har frågor om tjänsten, kontakta rekryterande chef Charlotta Thelander, charlotta.thelander@ica.se. För frågor om urvalsprocessen eller villkor på ICA, kontakta Markus Öhman, Rekryterare, 076-695 62 04.
   

  

 Ansök så snart som möjligt, dock senast den 27 april 2025.
   

  

 ICA strävar efter att spegla våra kunder och samhället, och vi försöker därför anställa människor med olika bakgrund, kompetenser, kunskaper och erfarenheter. Vi värdesätter goda arbetsmiljöförhållanden med målet att ha helt rökfria arbetsplatser. Om rollen kräver det, kan du behöva genomgå tester, bakgrundskontroller och drogtester före anställning.

title: Java Web Developer
description:
**Javautvecklare till Research and Analysis of Media (RAM)** 




  





**Plats:** 




 Stockholm (stora möjligheter till hybrid)
 



  





**Omfattning:** 




 Heltid/Deltid
 



  





**Anställningsform:** 




 Tillsvidare
 



  





**Om RAM** 




 Research and Analysis of Media AB (RAM) är ett internationellt medieanalysföretag som hjälper världens ledande mediehus, konsulter och annonsörer att förstå hur deras kommunikation faktiskt tas emot. Med över 80 miljoner genomförda intervjuer i ryggen och världens största referensdatabas för media, levererar vi insikter som gör skillnad.
 



 Vårt huvudkontor ligger i Stockholm och vi har systerbolag i både USA och Storbritannien. Totalt är vi 22 medarbetare, varav 14 i Sverige – ett tight, engagerat team med högt i tak.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Vi söker dig som brinner för Javautveckling och vill vara med och vidareutveckla/förvalta vårt webbaserade undersökningssystem. Du blir en viktig del i ett litet men erfaret team på tre seniora utvecklare och får jobba med hela utvecklingsprocessen – från förstudie till drift.
 



  





**I rollen får du:** 




 - Utveckla och förbättra användarvänliga lösningar tillsammans med våra interna beställare 
 



 - Arbeta i ett team med öppen dialog, pragmatisk inställning och starkt driv
 



 - Möjlighet att växa och påverka både teknikval och arkitektur
 



  





**Vi tror att du har:** 




 - God kunskap inom Java, J2EE och JSP
 



 - Vana vid HTML, CSS och JavaScript (meriterande om du arbetat med Vue.js eller jQuery liknande)
 



 - Några års erfarenhet av webbutveckling i Java
 



 - Erfarenhet av databashantering (t.ex. SQL, IBM DB2)
 



 - Fördel om du arbetat med Elasticsearch
 



 - Bonus om du har kunskap kring IBM WebSphere Application server
 



  





 Men viktigast är att du är nyfiken, självgående och gillar att lösa problem tillsammans med andra. Är du nyutexaminerad med passion för kod? Då vill vi gärna träffa dig också!
 



  





**Varför RAM?** 




  





 Hos oss får du:
 



 - Arbeta med ett välbeprövat och samtidigt levande system som används globalt
 



 - Bli en del av ett litet och dedikerat team med stor expertis
 



 - Möjlighet att påverka – både teknik och arbetssätt
 



 - Flexibilitet och balans mellan jobb och privatliv
 



  





**Ansökan** 




  





 Låter det intressant? Skicka din ansökan till jobb@rampanel.com så snart som möjligt – urval sker löpande. Har du frågor om tjänsten? Tveka inte att höra av dig!
 



  





  





 RAM Research and Analysis of Media 
 



 Box 3217
 



 103 64 Stockholm
 



 sales\_swe@rampanel.com
 



 support\_swe@rampanel.com

title: Embedded Engineer
description:
**Job Title:** 
 Embedded Developer – Automotive Cyber Security
 



**Location:** 
 Hybrid – Minimum 3 days per week onsite in Södertälje, Sweden
 



  





  





**Assignment Overview:** 




  





  





 Join a collaborative and dynamic team comprised of system owners, function owners, testers, and developers working within the steering domain of modern vehicles. We are seeking an experienced
 **Embedded Developer** 
 with a strong background in
 **automotive cyber security** 
 to contribute to the development and security of steering systems and embedded vehicle platforms. A short start-up time is ideal, so previous experience at the client’s site is highly meriting.
 



  





  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  





  




* Design, develop, and maintain embedded software for steering systems with a focus on cyber security.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure secure and efficient system integration.
* Support and implement client-specific cyber security requirements.
* Participate in testing, debugging, and documentation of embedded systems.
* Engage in regular team meetings and contribute to the overall project goals.



  





  





**Requirements:** 




  





  




* Proven experience in embedded systems development, preferably within the automotive sector.
* Strong understanding of automotive cyber security principles.
* Ability to interpret and implement client-specific cyber security standards and requirements.
* Comfortable working in a hybrid environment, with a minimum of 3 days per week onsite in Södertälje.



  





  





**Education:** 




  





  




* College or university degree in Engineering or related technical discipline.



  





  





**Language:** 




  





  




* Proficient in English. All team communication and documentation are conducted in English.



  





  





**Meriting (Preferred Qualifications):** 




  





  




* Prior experience with the client’s electrical system and/or embedded vehicle systems.
* Familiarity with steering systems and control functions.
* Previous assignments or work experience with the client.
* Possession of a C or CE driver’s license.



  





  





**If you are interested, or you know someone that could be please reach out and we can arrange a time to speak?**

title: Business Developer AI - Graduate
description:
This role has been designed as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2 days per week from an HPE office.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Joining HPE in a graduate role is an excellent opportunity for a self-motivated, proactive individual to grow with us and help us drive our continued success globally.
   

  

 We are seeking a junior
 **Business Developer** 
 passionate about AI to join our team. In this role, you will focus on AI business development, providing sales support, building strategic partnerships, and gaining a deep understanding of HPE AI products. If you have a keen interest in the AI market development and are excited to contribute to the evolving needs for enterprise companies, we want to hear from you!
   

  

**Program start date** 
 : SEPTEMBER 2025
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* You will work with Sales teams to identify needs and drive initiatives to enable a successful sales motion of HPE AI portfolio
* You will, together with Product Category Managers, define and perform activities to drive AI business growth
* You will support the Business Unit Manager in building a Go To Market around AI to Customer Industry Verticals
* You will continuously build knowledge around AI in the market and contribute ideas linked to the HPE AI portfolio to drive business growth
* You will compile and analyse data that will be utilized to make business decisions
* You will support in developing partnerships with AI actors on the Swedish market
* You will, together with colleagues, help to build the HPE AI brand by participating in AI communities


**About You**
* Completed Bachelor’s/Master’s degree within the last 12 months with a focus in computer science, business, economics, or related
* Native level of Swedish. Strong verbal and written communication skills in English.
* Genuine interest in the world of AI and proven knowledge of AI concepts/terminology
* Experience or a proven interest in sales and a passion for technology
* Skilled in communication and enjoys sharing knowledge with others
* Strong solution mindset and a drive to proactively strive for improvements
* Capable of learning and acting under limited time constraints
* Organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks in an effective order
* Ability to drive business relationships and build trust
* Team player with ability to work independently


**What We’d Prefer You Bring**
* The drive to seek out what’s next and to deliver exceptional results
* A collaborative, solution-focused spirit and overall sense of urgency
* The desire to embrace new ideas and fresh thinking and seek out ideas different than your own
* Experience as an active leader on campus who strives to make a positive impact on the world
* Comfort with working in a hybrid (virtual and face-to-face) environment
* Exceptional communication and presentation skills and the ability to ask smart questions


**What You Can Expect From Us**
* Initial extensive onboarding to support you with adjusting to the role
* Ongoing learning and development throughout the program
* Be mentored by at least one senior member of the team, and after two years in the program, you can grow into a true professional with valuable relationships and international working experience
* Competitive salary and great benefits
* Great work-life balance, including hybrid working and Wellness Fridays initiative


**At HPE, We’re**
* Human Rights Campaign’s 2023-2024 Corporate Equality Index
* Great Place to Work’s Best Workplace for Parents 2023
* Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® 2024
* Ethisphere World’s Most Ethical Company 2024
* The Civic 50 Honoree
* JUST Jobs Leader 2024
* Forbes 2024 America’s Best Employers For Diversity
* America's Most Just Companies 2024
* Fortune Best Workplaces in Texas™ 2024
* Bay Area's Best Places to Work 2024


 Want to learn more about Digital Sales careers at HPE?
   

  

 Try our new virtual experience program, where you can explore what’s next for you in this role and earn shareable completion certificates that stand out to HPE recruiters and hiring managers. https://careers.hpe.com/us/en/students-virtual-experiences
   

  

 #Sweden #grads
   

  

**Additional Skills**
 Accountability, Accountability, Action Planning, Active Learning (Inactive), Active Listening, Bias, Business, Calendar Management, Coaching, Computer Literacy, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Design Thinking, Empathy, Follow-Through, Group Problem Solving, Growth Mindset, Intellectual Curiosity (Inactive), Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity, Office Administration, Policy and procedures, Recordkeeping, Risk Assessment, Software Development {+ 5 more}
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**
**Health & Wellbeing**
 We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.
   

  

**Personal & Professional Development**
 We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.
   

  

**Unconditional Inclusion**
 We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.
   

  

**Let's Stay Connected**
 Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.
   

  

 #sweden

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, or any other protected category, and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.
