**As a Security Engineer, You Will**
* Coordinate penetration testing efforts and track remediations.
* Conduct threat modelling sessions, secure code review and vulnerability assessments.
* Develop and enforce cloud and infrastructure as code (IaC) security policies.
* Collaborate with engineering teams to ensure security best practices and secure software development life cycle SSDLC (Shift-Left).
* Improve cloud security monitoring by building and managing detections.


**This is you**
 To succeed in this role, we believe that you take great pride in your work, are curious and continuously want to learn and grow. Believing in collaboration and discussing ideas and concepts with your colleague, you will serve as the first point of contact for our Platform teams as a Cloud Security Subject Matter Expert to enable the delivery of great products.
   

  

**As a Security Engineer, You Have**
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Detail-oriented mindset with a focus on delivering high-quality results.
* Strong stakeholder management skills, ability to work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Ability to understand and implement security requirements in cloud environments
* Experience with security best practices and vulnerability management process
* Knowledge of Google Cloud Platform (Security Command Centre, GKE, IAM), infrastructure as code (Terraform) and Github
* Familiarity with programming and major frameworks (Java Spring, React)
* Knowledge of SIEM solutions and ability to do log analysis


**What We Offer**
* Your expertise and contribution will be appreciated from day one
* Plenty of opportunities to grow as a security professional
* Competitive salary and compensation


 We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of sharp and committed colleagues. Our teams are autonomous and embrace the agile way of working.
   

  

 Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do.
   

  

 We are over 900 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen.
   

  

 Visit us on:
 **career.nordnetab.com/pages/engineering**
 Learn more about Nordnet in our brand movie
 **This is Nordnet** 
 , that describes our identity.
   

  

**Questions & applications**
 Apply today – we will start interviewing immediately. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered.
   

  

 If you have questions, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner Keri Bergström Käll at keri.bergstrom.kall@nordnet.com
   

  

 We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing as a part of our recruitment process.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Office Assistant Front Desk
description:
**Office Assistant– Front Desk (temporary until august)**
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 We are currently seeking a temporary Office Assistant – Front Desk until mid-august.
   

  

 In this role, you are responsible for ensuring the seamless operation of AXA XL’s office Stockholm. As an Office Assistant you ensure a safe, tidy, organized, and operational work environment to provide an exceptional office and workplace experience.
   

  

**DISCOVERyour opportunity**
 What will your essential responsibilities include?
   

  

* Manage front desk tasks, mail and incoming enquiries, answering phone, liaise with cleaners and property manager.
* Welcoming visitors and ensuring they have a positive impression of AXA XL.
* Monitor and maintain office supplies (stationary, paper, office material etc.)
* Collaborating with HR and IT to facilitate onboarding for new employees, including administering access cards, fire safety, ordering work equipment and local IT setup.
* Setting up and preparing conference rooms for meetings.
* Coordinating and organizing local meetings and events, both internal and external.


 You will report to the Nordic Operations Manager.
   

  

**SHARE your talent**
 We’re looking for someone who has these abilities and skills:
   

  

* Good overall office and administrative services qualifications
* IT literacy, Microsoft Office package literacy as a minimum
* Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) in Swedish and English
* Well-developed social skills, ability to communicate and network with people on all levels
* Excellent organizational skills
* Multitasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks
* Proactive approach
* Attention to detail and system entering


 Applications should be made via the online form in the Career section on AXA XL’s website.
   

  

 If you have questions about the position, please contact AXA XL’s Operations Manager, Mathias Frick, at mathias.frick@axaxl.com
   

  

**FIND your future**
 AXA XL, the P&C and specialty risk division of AXA, is known for solving complex risks. For mid-sized companies, multinationals and even some inspirational individuals we don’t just provide re/insurance, we reinvent it.
   

  

 How? By combining a comprehensive and efficient capital platform, data-driven insights, leading technology, and the best talent in an agile and inclusive workspace, empowered to deliver top client service across all our lines of business − property, casualty, professional, financial lines and specialty.
   

  

 With an innovative and flexible approach to risk solutions, we partner with those who move the world forward.
   

  

 Learn more at axaxl.com
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 AXA XL is committed to equal employment opportunity and will consider applicants regardless of gender, sexual orientation, age, ethnicity and origins, marital status, religion, disability, or any other protected characteristic.
   

  

 At AXA XL, we know that an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce enable business growth and are critical to our success. That’s why we have made a strategic commitment to attract, develop, advance and retain the most diverse workforce possible, and create an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their full selves to work and can reach their highest potential. It’s about helping one another — and our business — to move forward and succeed.
   

  

* Five Business Resource Groups focused on gender, LGBTQ+, ethnicity and origins, disability and inclusion with 20 Chapters around the globe
* Robust support for Flexible Working Arrangements
* Enhanced family friendly leave benefits
* Named to the Diversity Best Practices Index
* Signatory to the UK Women in Finance Charter


 Learn more at axaxl.com/about-us/inclusion-and-diversity . AXA XL is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
   

  

**Sustainability**
 At AXA XL, Sustainability is integral to our business strategy. In an ever-changing world, AXA XL protects what matters most for our clients and communities. We know that sustainability is at the root of a more resilient future. Our 2023-26 Sustainability strategy, called “Roots of resilience”, focuses on protecting natural ecosystems, addressing climate change, and embedding sustainable practices across our operations.
   

  

**Our Pillars**
* Valuing nature : How we impact nature affects how nature impacts us. Resilient ecosystems - the foundation of a sustainable planet and society – are essential to our future. We’re committed to protecting and restoring nature – from mangrove forests to the bees in our backyard – by increasing biodiversity awareness and inspiring clients and colleagues to put nature at the heart of their plans.
* Addressing climate change : The effects of a changing climate are far reaching and significant. Unpredictable weather, increasing temperatures, and rising sea levels cause both social inequalities and environmental disruption. We're building a net zero strategy, developing insurance products and services, and mobilizing to advance thought leadership and investment in societal-led solutions.
* Integrating ESG : All companies have a role to play in building a more resilient future. Incorporating ESG considerations into our internal processes and practices builds resilience from the roots of our business. We’re training our colleagues, engaging our external partners, and evolving our sustainability governance and reporting.
* AXA Hearts in Action : We have established volunteering and charitable giving programs to help colleagues support causes that matter most to them, known as AXA XL’s “Hearts in Action” programs. These include our Matching Gifts program, Volunteering Leave, and our annual volunteering day – the Global Day of Giving.


 For more information, please see axaxl.com/sustainability
   

  

**Flexible Work Eligible**
 None
   

  

 AXA XL is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
   

  

**Location**
 SE-SE-Stockholm
   

  

**Job Field**
 Management And Business Support
   

  

**Schedule**
 Full-time
   

  

**Job Type**
 Standard

title: Senior Industrial Designer – IT / Consumer Electronics / Home Robotics
company_industry: Design Services, Computers and Electronics Manufacturing, and Robot Manufacturing
description:
We are looking for a
 **Senior Industrial Designer** 
 to join an established team at a world leading technology company at their design lab in
 **Stockholm.** 




  





 As a
 **Senior Industrial Designer** 
 your responsibilities will include:
 



  




* Lead the industrial design process from concept through to product realization.
* Translate user insights, design trends, & industry shifts into compelling product solutions.
* Collaborate across disciplines to ensure user desirability, engineering feasibility, & market relevance.
* Rapidly visualize & iterate design concepts using sketches, CAD models, & physical prototypes.
* Present & justify design proposals to stakeholders, including senior leadership.
* Contribute to the creation of a consistent & innovative product portfolio through design branding.
* Drive workshops & guide teams through the design process while providing constructive feedback.



  





 As a
 **Senior Industrial Designer** 
 your skills will include:
 



  




* Bachelors, Masters or PhD in Industrial Design, Product Design or relevant domain
* 3-8 years’ experience in design engineering; either in-house or consultancy-based.
* Track record of delivering successful designs for high-profile clients.
* Strong command of form, color, material, & finish (CMF).
* Familiarity with global design trends, consumer behavior, & emerging technologies.
* Hands-on experience in design execution, model-making, & testing.
* Skilled in design software such as Rhino, CREO, Adobe CC, & Keyshot.
* Comfortable leading design efforts while also contributing directly.
* Excellent presentation & communication skills, with the ability to engage a range of stakeholders.
* Recognized nationally or internationally for outstanding design contributions



  





  





 Feel free to also refer someone you may know who could be good for the role. If they are successfully placed, we offer a great referral scheme!
 



  





 Key words – IT / Consumer Electronics / Home Robotics / Smart Home / Radio Units / Antennas / Routers / Industrial Design / Product Design / Keyshot / SolidWorks / Adobe Photoshop / Rhino / Adobe Illustrator / Pro-E / CREO / 3DS
 



  





*By applying to this role, you understand that we may collect your personal data & store & process it on our systems. For more information please see our Privacy Notice.*

title: Senior Applikationsextpert
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 4 års erfarenhet
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet gällande konfiguration och utveckling inom verktyget Sparx Enterprise Architect.
* Erfarenhet av konfiguration och administration av Sparx Prolaborate och Pro Cloud


 Server.
   

  

* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 01-05-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Senior Backendutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Nyutveckling och vidareutveckling sker i Java och Spring Boot. Hög grad av samarbete med andra i teamet så som testare, systemutvecklare, scrum master och produktägare. Även samarbete med andra utvecklingsteam och plattformsteam med fokus på kontinuerlig leverans.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av utveckling i Java
* Minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av utveckling i SpringFramework
* Minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av utveckling av REST API-er för webbtjänster
* Kunskap och praktisk erfarenhet av CI/CD-verktyg i containerbaserad lösning
* Kunskap och praktisk erfarenhet av Git/Bitbucket och Open Shift (konfiguration och förvaltning)
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av utveckling i autonoma agila utvecklingsteam

* Erfarenhet av en komplex utvecklingsmiljö med många systemintegrationer
* Erfarenhet av incidenthantering, drift och förvaltning samt en del vidare- och nyutveckling
* Förmåga att samarbeta effektivt med hela arbetslaget genom att delta i arbetsmöten, bidra till förbättringsarbete och ta styrning från produktledning (Produktägare/Scrum Master/Mjukvaruarkitekt) Samt besitta förmåga att självständigt driva sina åtaganden samtidigt som hen även tar ansvar för teamets leverans

 07-05-2025

 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: ALTEN Industry söker Mekanikkonstruktörer
description:
Som mekanikkonstruktör kommer du vara i framkanten för utveckling av nya produkter och komponenter. Förutom att tillgodose kundernas krav på kvalitet, kommer du i ditt uppdrag också bidra till att produkterna möter satta krav vad gäller budget och tidsplan. Du får chansen att utvärdera tekniska koncept med avseende på tillverkningsmetoder, hållfasthetskrav, mekaniska fogningsmetoder, kostnad samt estetik, och du kommer jobba i nära samarbete med både projektledare, konceptdesigners, testingenjörer, CAE-ingenjörer samt andra mekanikingenjörer.
 



  





 För att trivas i rollen är det viktigt att du är driven och initiativtagande, samt har en inneboende nyfikenhet att lära dig nya tekniker och produkter. Du är som person en driven teamplayer med hög social kompetens och simultanförmåga eftersom du kommer arbeta med flera projekt parallellt.
 



  





**Vad erbjuder vi?** 




 Varje medarbetare är lika viktig i ALTENs framgång! Vi tror på att växa tillsammans genom att erbjuda möjligheter, utveckling och gemenskap. ALTEN verkar inom flera olika branscher, har en stor variation av uppdrag, coachande chefer och utbildning via ALTEN Academy vilket gör att det alltid kommer vara möjligt att utvecklas hos oss. Dina önskemål styr din väg framåt.
 



  





 Som konsult får du både en teamkänsla i ditt uppdrag och en riktigt härlig gemenskap på ALTEN. Genom våra interna nätverk såsom Women@ALTEN och ALTEN Sports ges du möjlighet att driva frågor och aktiviteter som just du brinner för. På ALTEN tycker vi det är viktigt med balans mellan arbete och fritid, därför erbjuder vi tre extra lediga dagar per år. Hos oss är du ansluten till kollektivavtal och erbjuds förmåner så som friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension och försäkringar.
 



  





**Krav:** 




  




* Kandidat eller Master inom maskinteknik eller liknande
* Minst 3 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
* Erfarenhet i åtminstone ett av följande CAD-verktyg: CREO, SolidWorks eller Siemens NX
* Erfarenhet av att ha jobbat med olika material som plast, metall, gjutgods
* Goda kommunikativa färdigheter samt behärska engelska väl i tal och skrift.



  





 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan – rekryteringsarbetet sker löpande!
 



  





**Om ALTEN** 




 ALTEN är ett av Europas största teknik- och IT-konsultföretag med över 57 000 anställda cirka 30 länder. Våra ingenjörer utför komplexa och mycket tekniska projekt genom hela produktutvecklingskedjan hos de främsta företagen inom flera olika branscher såsom Fordon, Försvar & Säkerhet, Energi, Industriell utrustning, Public service samt Life sciences. I Sverige är vi cirka 1300 engagerade medarbetare med 9 kontor i 9 städer - från Lund i söder till Skellefteå i norr.
 



  





 ALTEN har för femte året i rad utsetts till en av Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare av Karriärföretagen, en utmärkelse för arbetsgivare som erbjuder unika karriär- och utvecklingsmöjligheter.

title: Project Manager / Scrum Master
description:
**Role:**
 You are an experienced project manager and extra meriting will be experience from the insurance industry in general and business transformation driven by core system changes within insurance and Lumera Core in particular.
   

  

 You are a team player with great communication skills able to lead and collaborate with specialists for example within Product, Customer Service, IT, Sales, Finance and Actuaries.
   

  

 You are well structured with general project management skills such as in planning, change management, making presentations, facilitating workshops, creating decision materials et cetera. You are self-going and take high responsibility for your deliveries, on time with high quality. You are fluent in Swedish and English.
   

  

 You will partly act as a Scrum master so you are well structured in facilitating sprint ceremonies such as daily stand-ups, sprint planning and reviews.
   

  

 You have strong leadership, coaching, and interpersonal skills to engage stakeholders and motivate teams.
   

  

 As partly Scrum master you have
   

  

* Demonstrated lean and agile mindset with hands-on experience in a SAFe delivery environment, managing interdependencies with other teams and projects.
* Understand the importance of rapid iteration cycles, incorporating continuous user feedback while maintaining delivery commitments.
* Proven ability to establish new teams, focusing on effective ways of working and fostering a psychologically safe environment that encourages learning and sharing.
* Courageous in speaking up for the team when necessary.


****Essential requirements:****
 Project Management Expertise (4+ years) Agile and Scrum Master Proficiency Insurance Industry Knowledge (Preferably with Lumera Core)
 - Strong Interpersonal and Leadership Abilities

**Meritorious:**
* Previous High-Impact, Strategic Role experience
* Previous experience within Product, Customer Service, IT, Sales, Finance and Actuaries


**Please explain how you meet all the requirements** 
**when applying.**
**Utilization** 
**:** 
 100
 **%**
**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Period** 
 : 05-05-2025-31-12-2025
   

  

**Last day to apply** 
 : 24-04-2025
   

  

 We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

title: Data Warehouse Expert
description:
Are you skilled in data warehouse, data engineering and ready for new challenges? We are looking for consultants to join our Financial Services team in Stockholm.
   

  

 As an consultant at CGI, you are offered a global arena with the opportunity to take your career to next step within data and insights.
   

  

 We at CGI believe in the idea that we can go further if we thrive and work together. Our breadth of assignments and colleagues creates an optimal environment to grow and develop; both as a team and as individuals. Every day we build each other, our clients and our business.
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities
   

  

 Working as a data warehouse/data engineering expert at CGI means a varied everyday life. Here you are offered the opportunity to develop as a consultant both in local customer deliveries and in major global commitments. You can work in small, short projects a few months to large long commitments. We participate in and run projects and commitments on site at our client´s offices, but mainly from our local offices. We work both individually and together with other colleagues in our projects. Our assignments are carried out with the support of established methods and models based on industry standards.
   

  

 As a data warehouse expert, you will be responsible for bringing expertise in data modeling and data engineering. You will be part of a team that delivers solutions to our major clients in the financial services sector. You will independently engage with expert stakeholders at Sweden's top-tier banks and insurance companies to solve their most demanding challenges. Your role will involve solving complex digital initiatives, facilitating the decision-making process, and quickly finding solutions to emerging obstacles. Your deliverables will require close collaboration with highly skilled, multidisciplinary teams spread across different geographies.
   

  

**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
 To succeed in this role, we are looking for someone with a strong drive and a client-focused
   

  

 mindset. You have experience in data and solution creation and are used to working in complex environments. Additionally, you hold an academic degree in computer science, technology, or engineering.
   

  

 We want you to have experience from / within:
   

  

* Design and implement advanced Data Warehouse solutions that enable agile data modeling and analysis
* Data architecture
* Optimization and management of data flows to ensure high availability and performance. Design/develop ETL
* Drive the transition to and an understanding of Cloud Architecture for designing robust solutions that incorporate technology, strategy, culture, and processes
* Data Migration experience – Teradata/Oracle/SQL Server or Hadoop workloads to cloud DWH (Snowflake/RedShift/Big Query)
* IT Application Support
* Strong technical team leadership mentorship and collaboration


****What You Can Expect Fom Us****
 CGI's combination of global and local presence, with offices in more than 28 locations in Sweden, provides satisfied clients and also means that you as an employee always have an office near you.
   

  

 At CGI, there are also great opportunities for internal career paths where you can choose to become a specialist in your field, broaden yourself in new areas or take a senior position. Through our internal networks, projects and commitments in global and national industries, we offer you competence development and committed leaders who support you in your development.
   

  

**Want to know more?**
 We look forward to hearing from you! If there is still something you are wondering about, feel free to contact Vishal Khaparde, vishal.khaparde@cgi.com. Good Luck!
   

  

**CGI**
 CGI is leading the digitalisation of Sweden and is a world leader in transforming innovation, information and technology. Through deep industry knowledge and an understanding of the client's challenges, we contribute insights to create sustainable results. We are located in 40 countries with 76,000 employees. In Sweden, our 4,000 employees are located in 30 locations with headquarters in Stockholm. Read more about CGI on our website: www.cgi.se.
   

  

**Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.**
 Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…
   

  

 You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.
   

  

 Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.
   

  

 You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
   

  

 Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

title: Arkivarie
location: Upplands Väsby och Sollentuna, Stockholm County, Sweden
description:
Vi söker en arkivarie till kommunarkivet i Sollentuna kommun. Kommunarkivet består dels av det historiska pappersarkivet, dels av e-arkivet som också är framtidens arkiv och som kommer behöva utvecklas vidare under kommande år.
   

  

 I kommunarkivet förvaras över 2 hyllkilometer och 2 terabyte handlingar från 1500-talet till idag. Arkivet har en tradition av utåtriktat arbete med visningar, föredrag och en digital forskarsal. Vi arrangerar även evenemang på Arkivens dag med höga besökssiffror. I våra nyrenoverade lokaler i Turebergshuset hanterar vi utlämningar av allmänna handlingar och levandegör Sollentunas historia för nya generationer.
   

  

 Arkivarien ingår i digitaliseringsenheten tillsammans med kommunarkivarie samt verksamhetsarkivarie, IT-arkitekt, dataskyddssamordnare, informationssäkerhetssamordnare samt förändringsledare för digital utveckling. Du rapporterar till chefen för digitaliseringsenheten. Kommunarkivarien har en föreståndarroll för det samlade kommunarkivet.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som arkivarie är ditt uppdrag att
   

  

* Vara med och utveckla och förvalta kommunens e-arkivsystem
* Delta i arbetet med planering av systemleveranser till e-arkivet i samarbete med kontoren och i arbetet för att genomföra planen
* Förvalta kommunens historiska arkiv och tillgängliggöra material ur detta för andra genom kommunens digitala forskarsal och andra aktiviteter
* Bistå organisation och allmänhet med utlämnande av allmänna handlingar från kommunarkivet


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

* Högskoleutbildning med minst 60 hp/40 p i arkivvetenskap
* Några års erfarenhet av arbete med såväl e-arkiv som historiska arkiv i en offentlig organisation


 Personliga egenskaper
   

  

 Du ska
   

  

* vara intresserad av digital utveckling och digital teknik
* tycka om att skapa ordning och strukturer men samtidigt ha ett pragmatiskt förhållningssätt
* ha god social kompetens och tycka om att samarbeta med andra då du kommer ha kontakter inom och utom organisationen
* gilla utveckling, förändring och nytänkande både hos dig själv och dina kollegor
* vara analytisk och kompetent i att presentera underlag både skriftligt och muntligt


 Övrigt
   

  

 Tjänsten kräver säkerhetsklassning och svenskt medborgarskap
   

  

 Välkommen till Sollentuna – en kommun mitt i möjligheterna! Tillsammans gör vi Sollentuna bättre varje dag för våra invånare, företagare och organisationer. Vi har tydliga och ambitiösa mål för att skapa trygghet, välfärd och hållbar tillväxt. Vi erbjuder dig ett meningsfullt och roligt jobb i en stabil miljö där ambitionsnivån är hög. Hos oss får du fantastiska kollegor som vill göra skillnad för andra. Nu söker vi dig som är nytänkande, ansvarstagande och välkomnande. Följ med oss på resan mot att skapa Sveriges mest attraktiva kommun!
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 | Ort: Sollentuna | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/114 | Kontakt: Pierre Karlsson 08-57921520, | Publicerat: 2025-04-02 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-04-27

title: Marketing & Communications Coordinator
description:
Are you interested in working for a truly global company where you get to combine passion with purpose? Then this is the opportunity for you.
   

  

 Zurich is a leading insurance carrier that applies its expertise and experience so businesses can have the very best insurance protection and access to risk management and mitigation services. We are now looking for a creative, structured, results-driven and service-minded Marketing & Communications Coordinator to support the Nordic Head of Marketing & Communication.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 The purpose of this role is to support profitable business growth by activating, implementing and optimizing the output of Zurich Nordic’s planned activities based on the marketing and communication strategy. You will be operating hands-on and play a key part in strengthening the Zurich brand and building engagement across Denmark, Finland, Norway, and Sweden. You will collaborate with international teams and external partners to drive marketing and communication success.
   

  

 Your responsibilities will include producing content such as thought leadership, and promotional material for our sales team and marketing channels which includes our website and social media platforms. You will also support the planning and execution of a variety of events such as seminars, webinars and other relationship-building activities.
   

  

 Additionally, you will support the execution of internal communication activities and employer branding campaigns.
   

  

 In the Marketing & Communications department, we seek continuous improvements in processes and working methods. It will be focal to have a results-driven approach where monitoring key performance indicators help us excel. Continuously conducting market research to identify trends and customer needs will be important to ensure ongoing enhancement.
   

  

 At Zurich, all of our passion goes into helping our customers understand, manage and minimize risks and hence optimize their risk management. Therefore, your overall aim will be to ensure high customer satisfaction.
   

  

**Qualifications:**
* 2-3 years of experience in marketing, PR, project management, event management, or related fields.
* A bachelor’s degree or equivalent in marketing, communication or a related field.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills in Swedish and English are mandatory, with proficiency equivalent to the C2 level.


**Preferred Knowledge and Experience in:**
* B2B marketing
* CRM systems and email marketing platforms
* Sitecore
* LinkedIn Sales Navigator
* Fluency in Norwegian, Danish or Finnish


**Skills and competencies:**
* Positive and service-minded attitude with a sales-driven customer-centricity focus. A team-player who is also able to carry out tasks independently.
* A creative yet analytical approach; with excellent planning and time-management skills you are a doer focusing on execution and results, structured and always meeting deadlines.
* The ability to manage multiple projects and adapt to changing priorities.
* Strong understanding of content creation including copywriting, as well as graphic design, and video production in Canva.
* Data-driven mindset with the ability to analyze marketing metrics and derive actionable insights.
* Experience as a social media editor, especially LinkedIn.


**What we can offer you:**
* Hybrid working
* Competitive compensation package
* Occupational pension
* Wellbeing initiatives
* Benefit package
* Comprehensive insurance package
* Global Career development
* A diverse and inclusive workplace
* Great location in the central part of Stockholm


 Please refer any questions to Susanna Salomon, Nordic Head of Marketing & Communication, +46 70 333 92 76, susanna.salomon@zurich.com or Carl-Arvid Nilsson, Nordic Talent Acquisition Specialist, +46767203350, carlarvid.nilsson@zurich.com.
   

  

 You are welcome to submit your application online on 24 May 2025, at latest. The selection process will run continuously. We encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.
   

  

**About The Company**
 Zurich Nordic is the local arm of Zurich Insurance Group, one of the world’s leading insurance companies with over 63 000 employees. Zurich has been operating in the Nordic market for 150 years with offices in Stockholm, Oslo, Copenhagen and Helsinki, where we also serve the Baltic market.
   

  

 Zurich Nordic is a leading provider of commercial insurance solutions, as well as a wide range of risk management products and services, for businesses in the large corporate and middle market segment. We support companies with local and global presence, in more than 200 countries and territories.
   

  

 Reflecting its purpose to ‘create a brighter future together,’ Zurich aspires to be one of the most responsible and impactful businesses in the world. Its core values Optimism, Caring, Reliability, Togetherness, Forward-Thinking and Results Orientation guides its employees and informs every action they take. With Zurich, you can expect to work on challenges that will help you grow and to collaborate with a diverse and inclusive global team.

title: DevOps Engineer Native Apps
description:
**About the Role** 
 - A short paragraph summarizing the key role responsibilities.
 



  





  





 As we continue to enhance and scale our growing platform, we're looking for a motivated DevOps Engineer with strong hands-on and design skills to join our IT team. This role will focus primarily on supporting and evolving our native iOS and Android pipelines and infrastructure. The DevOps engineer should be able to diagnose and resolve problems reliably, lead continuous improvement culture, and have the patience to communicate with a variety of interdisciplinary stakeholders. Initiative, resourcefulness, and autonomy are key attributes for success. You will be comfortable diagnosing and resolving complex issues, fostering a culture of continuous improvement, and communicating effectively with a wide range of interdisciplinary stakeholders. We're looking for someone who is proactive, able to quickly understand and integrate complex systems, juggle multiple priorities, and think creatively to design simple, robust solutions to challenging problems. You know the software development lifecycle better than the back of your hand, and you're fully comfortable working in Agile environments.
 



  





  





**Responsibilities** 
 - List the main job duties and what the role will entail.
 



  





  




* Ownership of the CI/CD pipeline ensuring a stable and performant platform/process.
* Effective communication with Operation's and Development teams.
* Continuously improve processes and documentation.
* Effective resolution of assigned tickets and tasks.
* Documentation and Knowledge sharing.
* Provide end to end solutions including its execution.
* Provide user support to engineering teams.
* Set up tools and required infrastructure.
* Encourage and build automated processes wherever possible.
* Incident management and root cause analysis.
* Follow the company processes, procedures, and methodologies.
* Collaborate to achieve common goals.
* Support and act in line with the company values.
* Keep up to date with compliance training offered by the company.
* Ensure that you adhere to the Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations for your role.
* Identify and raise any non-compliance incidents promptly to your line manager.
* Challenge processes, policies and projects that will negatively impact compliance within the Group.
* Complete all mandatory compliance training assigned to you.
* Reach out to the Compliance Teams if unsure of any of your compliance obligations or the requirements are unclear.



  





  





**Qualifications** 
 - Education details
 



  





  





**Required Skills** 




  





  




* Ability to cope up with competing demands and remain focused on competing priorities.
* Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate with impact.
* Excellent time management and organisational skills.
* Can relate to employees at all levels of the organisation.
* Ability to gain co-operation and commitment.
* People focus.



  





  





**Preferred Skills** 




  





  




* Experience with Android and iOS native apps pipeline (Jenkins, Gitlab)
* Experience using Fastlane Automating iOS/Android build, code signing, testing, and deployment
* Experience with Gradle (Android) and Xcodebuild/xcodeproj/swift (iOS)
* Code signing and provisioning profiles (Apple Developer certificates, provisioning profiles, keychains)
* Keystore management (Android .keystore/.jks files)
* Versioning and app bundle management (.apk, .aab, .ipa)
* Testing tools like testFlight, XCTest, Appium or similar.
* Static code analysis tools like SonarQube, SwiftLint, Android Lint
* Experience managing macOS systems (Homebrew, Xcode CLI tools, and Android SDK/NDK, Jenkins agent, Gitlab runner, Tart)
* Running iOS simulators and Android emulators via CLI in CI
* Ability to write code to automate repeatable processes (Ansible, Python, Bash).
* Experience in using containers and orchestration to dockerize existing applications.
* Experience with docker clustering frameworks like Kubernetes, Docker Swarm.
* Experience using tools like Vault, Artifactory, ArgoCD.
* Understanding of Source Control Management systems like GIT and Bitbucket.
* Experience with provisioning tools to treat infrastructure as code, like Terraform.
* Experience with monitoring tools like Prometheus, Kibana, Grafana.
* Exposure to various infrastructure technologies such as Couchbase, Elasticsearch, Oracle, MSSQL, PostgreSQL, and Kafka.
* Exposure to Hyper-V, Openstack, VmWare, RHVE.
* Experience with Azure/GCP and AWS.



  





  





**Pay range and compensation package** 
 - Pay range or salary or compensation
 



  





  





**Equal Opportunity Statement** 
 - Include a statement on commitment to diversity and inclusivity.

title: Senior Animator
description:
At Avalanche Studios Group we are now crafting our next cutting-edge AAA game and we are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Animator to join us in our Stockholm Studio!
   

  

**The Position**
 As a Senior Animator you will be working with a talented team of programmers, designers and animators to fully realize content for our in-game features. The ideal candidate will have experience breathing life into characters and creatures. This position requires you to take on a considerable amount of ownership and responsibility. You are expected to bring your passion, highly developed animation skills and creative problem solving to contribute to our project on many levels.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Produce vibrant and exciting new (keyframe) animations for our project
* Collaborate in a cross-disciplinary environment in the creation of in-game content
* Work with the Animation Director and Leads to ensure that animation content which meets the expectations of quality, consistency and style
* Review animations with your team, and provide artistic and technical feedback and guidance
* Work with internal developers in ideating and troubleshoot animations
* Set up/work with animation state machines and blend trees
* Work with additive, partial and layered animation systems


**Who You Are**
* A highly skilled Animator who is passionate about animation and video games
* Strong skills and deep understanding of animation fundamentals in different styles (stylized, hyper-realistic, cartoony, etc.)
* Have accomplished observational skills (a keen eye) coupled with a strong understanding of weight distribution and pacing/timing
* 5+ years of experience working as an Animator in the games industry (preferably with keyframe)
* Be able to demonstrate and excel in production of keyframed and mocap animation for both humans and creatures
* Accomplished knowledge of current animation techniques and 3rd party animation Software (Maya and Motion Builder)
* Good communication skills and experience working in a team environment
* Having cinematic knowledge and experience working on cut scenes is a plus


*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.*
**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.

title: Client Manager
description:
**Company Description**
*Publicis Groupe is one of the largest communications groups in the world. We are building the agency model of the future and take a holistic approach to our clients’ challenges. By fusing together our media, creative, data and technology expertise, we are able to provide clients with integrated solutions, transformative ideas and compelling consumer experiences. We call it the Power of One.*
*We are proud winner of many awards and nominations, both in Sweden and internationally. But nothing makes us prouder than to work with clients and brands such as* 
*P&G, Disney, H&M, Mondelez, Volvo, VISA, Lantmännen, LEGO, Spotify, Perrigo, Renault and many more.*
*At Publicis, we put our people first. We are proud to be certified by Great Place to Work (2022, 2023, 2024), and have been recognized with a Magnet Award for our engaging culture (2023). Our goal is to become the leading workplace in our industry. We are based in a fantastic office in Odenplan, but also offer a flexible work policy.*
**Overview**
 As a Client Manager you are overall responsible for your clients’ campaign work, all the way from media recommendations and planning to execution, including budget allocation cross channel where you lead and work closely with channel specialists in the client team.
   

  

 As Client Manager you are also responsible for managing digital activations from start to finish. Including planning and buying, develop data-driven recommendations across all channels and continuously analyze and evaluate campaign results and support your clients with actionable recommendations.
   

  

 At Publicis Media we put the client in focus and are both reliable and daring when approaching our commitments. We build on best practices while continuously challenging ourselves and others both internally and towards our clients. This role puts high demands towards you being solution oriented while instilling trust in your relationships.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 In this role you are responsible for...
   

  

* Driving the daily work for the client and within the client team.
* Project Leadership: Managing multiple client projects and ensuring workflows and processes are followed.
* Overseeing the entire process from briefing to follow-up in campaign-specific activities, including defining KPIs, ensuring measurements, and implementing ongoing campaign optimizations.
* Independently managing administration and financial matters for the client.
* Ensuring compliance with implemented processes and templates for all recommendations, follow-ups, and ongoing reporting throughout the year.
* Receiving, interpreting, and asking supplementary questions to the client regarding their briefs.
* Ensuring that internal briefs to the client team are clear and contain relevant information, while also coordinating information and workflow, including managing deadlines.


**Qualifications**
 We are looking for a skilled self-leader with the ability to successfully lead and support cross-disciplinary teams. To succeed in this role, we believe you value collaboration, have a collective mindset, and enjoy communicating with and motivating people. The requirements for this role include:
   

  

* Academic or relevant post-secondary education.
* A minimum of 3 years of work experience in digital marketing, client management, or an equivalent field.
* Strong organizational and multitasking skills with an eye for detail.
* Knowledge of digital marketing, measurement, and measurement frameworks.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* A proactive attitude and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
* Problem-solving skills, with the ability to find solutions independently, within the team, or externally.
* Experience with media buying platforms, ad servers, or GA4 is a plus.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite; being a native user of project management tools is meritorious.


**Additional Information**
 In addition to a welcoming culture and inclusive environment with passionate colleagues we offer you:
   

  

**Career Opportunities**
 Local and Global opportunities through the Power Of One.
   

  

**Personal and Professional Learning**
 Global AI learning platform where you can participate in +30 000 classes and connect with colleagues from all over the world.
   

  

**Flexible Ways of Working**
 We want to be an employer where work life balance is cherished. We love to spend time with our colleagues at the office but also believe in the output of your work not where the work is being done.
   

  

**Work Your World**
 For six weeks a year, the world is yours. Every employee can work anywhere on the planet where there's a Publicis office. A new city, a favorite locale, or even a different country - Go. Grow. Explore.
   

  

**Mental Health**
 The happiness and health of our people is paramount to us. We work continuously on maintaining a healthy and safe working environment through initiatives that facilitate the well-being of our employees.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Generous benefit package.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Key Account Manager - Sweden
description:
**Description**
 Key Account Manager - Sweden
   

  

**About Astellas**
 At Astellas we are a progressive health partner, delivering value and outcomes where needed.
   

  

 We pursue innovative science, focussing initially on the areas of greatest potential and then developing solutions where patient need is high, often in rare or under-served disease areas and in life-threatening or life-limiting diseases and conditions.
   

  

 We work directly with patients, doctors and health care professionals on the front line to ensure patient and clinical needs are guiding our development activities at every stage.
   

  

 Our global vision for Patient Centricity is to support the development of innovative health solutions through a deep understanding of the patient experience. At Astellas, Patient Centricity isn’t a buzzword - it’s a guiding principle for action. We believe all staff have a role to play in creating a patient-centric culture and integrating an awareness of the patient into our everyday working practices, regardless of our role, team or division.
   

  

 We work closely with regulatory authorities and payers to find new ways to ensure access to new therapies. We deliver the latest insights and real-world evidence to inform the best decisions for patients and their care-givers, to ensure the medicines we develop continue to provide meaningful outcomes.
   

  

 Beyond medicines, we support our stakeholder communities to drive initiatives that improve awareness, education, access and ultimately standards of care.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 As the Key Account Manager in Sweden, you will take ownership and responsibility to drive business and performance in the defined Astellas portfolio in own territory. Main customers being Gynecologists, Urologists and GPs.
   

  

**Hybrid Working**
 At Astellas, we recognise that our employees enjoy having balance between their professional and home lives. We are proud of our hybrid approach which empowers you to have flexibility on whether to work from home or in the office.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and manage the defined Astellas portfolio in defined Key Accounts.
* Work in a true cross-functional manner according to Astellas' chosen Key Account Management way of working.
* Position Astellas products and establish Astellas as a preferred partner.
* Ensure high-level customer satisfaction by tailoring and utilizing customer channel preferences while implementing the company omnichannel vision.
* Analyze sales data, prioritize accounts, target customers, and provide feedback on market, competitor, and customer analysis for cross-functional District/Account Plan creation.
* Maintain compliance, conduct financial administration through the Concur system, complete Astellas SOP in the LMS system, and stay up to date with product and therapy area knowledge and skills.


**Essential Knowledge & Experience**
* Good knowledge of English and Swedish, both written and spoken.
* Self-driven, execution-oriented, with a pro-active and outgoing personality.
* Extensive proven experience in the Gynecologists & GP segment (3-4 years), preferably in Women’s Health.
* Good knowledge of Veeva systems and relevant software.
* Positive, responsible team player with a self-confident, innovative approach to competitors and colleagues.
* Proven track record of collaborating with or working in commercial, medical, and/or market access roles, with methodical work habits and openness to change.


**Education**
* Bachelor of Health Care or University degree or equivalent.


**Additional Information**
* This is a permanent full-time position.
* Position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
* This position follows our hybrid working model. Role requires a blend of home and minimum 2 days per week in our Stockholm office and will require on-site work, with GP, Specialist, Hospitals etc. Flexibility may be required in line with business need.


 We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Specialist inom test och kvalitetssäkring
description:
**Arbetsförmedlingen, VO IT, Sektionen Testplattformar** 




  





 Har du erfarenhet av att införa moderna arbetssätt inom test och kvalitetssäkring och vill bidra till att utveckla en samhällsbärande IT-verksamhet? Vi söker en kommunikativ och förändringsdriven specialist som vill coacha team i en tekniskt avancerad DevOps-miljö. Tillsammans får vi Sverige i arbete. Vill du bli en av oss?
 



  





**Sektionens uppdrag** 




  





 På sektionen Testplattformar bistår vi den övriga IT-verksamheten med expertkunskap och tjänster inom test och kvalitetssäkring. Sektionen består idag av ca 15 personer. Vi ansvarar för övergripande ramverk och riktlinjer för test och kvalitetssäkring, driver förändringsinitiativ och skapar förutsättningar för att IT-verksamheten ska bli skickliga på test i en DevOps kontext. Vi erbjuder tjänster inom exempelvis förändringsledning, test och kvalitetssäkring, Test Data Management (TDM), testautomatisering och prestandatest.
 



  





 Nu söker vi dig som med din kompetens och engagemang kan hjälpa oss att i ta nästa steg i vår utveckling av test och kvalitetssäkring på Arbetsförmedlingen.
 



  





**Beskrivning av tjänsten** 




  





 I rollen som specialist kommer du att hjälpa olika utvecklingsteam med att förbättra deras arbetssätt inom test och kvalitetssäkring. Vi arbetar med moderna tekniker och i stor utsträckning i containeriserade miljöer och du kommer att arbeta aktivt med att coacha och utbilda utvecklingsteamen i att anpassa arbetssätt och nyttja de nya tekniska förutsättningarna i enlighet med gemensamma riktlinjer. Det ställer stora krav på din förmåga att kommunicera och bygga bra samarbeten med utvecklingsteamen.
 



  





 Ditt arbete ger nytta och värde till våra intressenter så det är viktigt att du tycker om att samverka med andra team och produkter och på så vis bygger förtroende i organisationen.
 



  





**Vårt erbjudande** 




  





 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid som inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Placeringsort är Solna.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder dig möjligheten att arbeta på en arbetsplats där vi värdesätter balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Du får tillgång till ett generöst semesteravtal, flexibla arbetstider samt möjlighet att arbeta på distans upp till 49 procent på årsbasis. Hos oss ingår även friskvård under arbetstid och ett förmånligt friskvårdsbidrag.
 



  





 Som anställd på Arbetsförmedlingen har du också tillgång till kompetensutveckling och karriärmöjligheter inom myndigheten. Genom vårt arbete bidrar vi till ett inkluderande och hållbart samhälle, där du får möjlighet att göra en verklig skillnad för individer och för samhället i stort.
 



  






 Mer om att jobba hos oss
 




  





  





**Grundläggande kvalifikationer** 




  




* Högskoleexamen med datainriktning eller motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt
* Flerårig erfarenhet av att praktiskt införa nya moderna arbetssätt inom test och kvalitetssäkring
* Mycket god kommunikativ förmåga på svenska i tal och skrift



  





**Övriga meriter för tjänsten** 




  




* Praktisk erfarenhet av tillämpning av arbetssätt för test och kvalitetssäkring i contatinermiljöer
* Erfarenhet av praktiska tillämpningar inom agil test, DevOps och CICD
* Kunskap om moderna testverktyg
* Praktisk erfarenhet av förändringsledning



  





 Det är viktigt att du har förmågan att tänka nytt och hitta lösningar för hur test och kvalitetssäkring bäst utförs i en DevOps kontext. Vi ser att du är en strukturerad person med starkt driv. Vi strävar efter att aktivt lära och låta oss inspireras av vår omvärld och självklart är det helt naturligt för dig att göra detsamma. Du vill få andra att växa och du gärna delar med dig av dina kunskaper och erfarenhet. Du har ett nätverkande och initiativtagande beteende och har lätt för att få med dig andra. I de sammanhang du verkar skapas energi och motivation!
 



  





 Utöver dessa kvalifikationer har du personlig förmåga och fallenhet att arbeta i enlighet med Arbetsförmedlingens medarbetarskap.
 



  





 Medarbetare på Arbetsförmedlingen:
 



  




* **Tar ansvar** 
 för sina arbetsprestationer och sitt bidrag till helheten
* **Anpassar sig** 
 till förändring och oförutsedda händelser
* **Tar initiativ** 
 till utveckling och bidrar till förbättring



  





**Ansökan** 




  





 Låter det här som en tjänst för dig? Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-05-08.
 



  





 Bifoga ditt CV där du specificerar årtal, månad och arbetsuppgifter för varje anställning, samt intyg som styrker kraven om utbildning och/eller arbetslivserfarenhet i din ansökan. Det är viktigt att du besvarar urvalsfrågorna detaljerat och sanningsenligt för att vi ska få en tydlig bild av din erfarenhet. Om efterfrågad information inte framgår riskerar du bli bortsållad i urvalet. Du behöver inte skicka in ett personligt brev.
 



  





 Under rekryteringsprocessen kan urvalstester förekomma. Vi kommer att hålla dig informerad genom hela rekryteringsprocessen. Mer om vår rekryteringsprocess -
 
 Mer om vår rekryteringsprocess.
 




  





 Har du skyddade personuppgifter kontaktar du den rekryteringspartner som finns namngiven i annonsen så får du hjälp med att skicka in din ansökan.
 



  





 Vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en myndighet fri från diskriminering. Det är viktigt för oss att all kompetens tas tillvara och vi välkomnar alla sökande. Vi ser positivt på om du har kunskaper i något av våra nationella minoritetsspråk.
 



  





**Välkommen till jobbet som får Sverige i arbete! Här arbetar du på regeringens uppdrag för en arbetsmarknad som hjälper människor framåt. Vi frigör möjligheter så att arbetssökande hittar sysselsättning och arbetsgivare sin nästa medarbetare. För att nå målet behöver vi samarbeta, i myndigheten men också med olika externa aktörer i hela landet. Tillsammans driver vi förändring, utvecklar nya arbetssätt och skapar lösningar som gör att Sverige kan fortsätta framåt.** 




  





 Mer om vår organisation och vårt uppdrag.

title: Account Manager
description:
As Maandag® Nordic expand into the Swedish market, we're looking for ambitious individuals to strengthen our sales organization as an
 **Account Manager** 
 . Do you get excited by the thought of an opportunity to be part of something new, work in an experienced and engaged team, and learn a lot along the way? In this role, you'll step into an entrepreneurial environment backed by the stability of a strong international company. If you're ready to grow with us and help shape our presence in the region, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

**Start:** 
 According to agreement, as soon as possible
   

**Extent:** 
 Full time
   

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

 As an Account Manager at Maandag® Nordic, you will play a key role in our journey to expand in Stockholm. Your main focus will be identifying new business opportunities and nurturing relationships with both new and existing clients within IT. With your entrepreneurial mindset, you'll build strong professional relationships and develop a sustainable network that will benefit you throughout your career. This is a great opportunity if you’re at the beginning of your career and you’re eager to learn, grow, and make an impact from day one.
   

  

**What you'll be doing**
 - Start your sales journey – as we enter the Swedish market, a big part of your role will be reaching out to new clients in Stockholm, supported closely by our Sales Manager.
   

 - Build strong relationships – learn how to understand client needs and help deliver tailored staffing and consulting solutions, working with our internal teams to ensure smooth processes and great service.
   

 - Grow through sales – you’ll develop your skills in prospecting and account management as part of a supportive and ambitious team.
   

 - Take charge of your development – this is a role where your results and drive open real career opportunities. 
   

  

**You are offered**
 - A unique opportunity to be part of the launch of Maandag® Nordics
   

 - A competitive and secure salary, with an uncapped bonus system 
   

 - Excellent career growth opportunities
   

 - Joy, laughter, and celebrating success together
   

 - 30 days of vacation
   

 - Pension benefits included
 


**Job requirements** 

**We are looking for someone who has:**
 - A degree or equivalent qualification in a relevant field
   

 - Experience in working in a high paced environment
   

 - An entrepreneurial and result driven mindset with a strong drive to succeed in a competitive market
   

 - Fluency in both English and Swedish
   

 - Driver’s license
   

  

 Good to have: 
   

 - Some experience from sales within the staffing or recruitment industry
   

  

 For this position, we will place great emphasis on the personal qualities that we consider important for the role. To thrive in the role as a Account Manager with us at Maandag® Nordic, we believe it's important that you enjoy thinking creatively, share your thoughts and opinions and that you want to be challenged and grow in your role. Being flexible in your work approach and enjoying working towards challenging goals is also key. We always strive to exceed our clients expectations, and are looking for someone that wants to join a team that always goes the extra mile. 
   





  
 


**Application procedure** 

 A Maandag® recruiter will assess your application as soon as possible to determine whether you are suitable for an open position.
   




**About the company** 

 Why Maandag Nordics? With us, you’ll get the chance to really put your ideas into action. We offer a work environment where you can grow and learn through hands-on experience - trying things out, making mistakes, and improving.
 



 For more than 35 years, Maandag® has been at the forefront of empowering people and organisations. We not only help professionals get jobs, but also connect them with a future that matches their values, desires and ambitions. Because when people are truly in the right place, they can develop themselves, fulfil their dreams and go to work with fresh energy every day. The energy and power released in the process is a catalyst for growth for companies. We started in the Netherlands, but now we also help professionals and organisations in Belgium, Poland, Dubai and Sweden. Our extensive knowledge of different markets, coupled with our wide network, enables us to make perfect matches quickly.

title: REXUS/BEXUS Program Manager
description:
Welcome to SSC – Swedish Space Corporation, the perfect workplace for those passionate about technology in general and space in particular.
   

  

 Our services enable successful space projects in telecommunications, security, meteorology, positioning, research, earth observation, and other applications. With space organizations, research institutes, institutional and commercial actors as customers, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications, space consulting services, rocket and balloon systems, flight test services, satellite propulsion systems, and much more.
   

  

**Are you fueled by a passion for people and the ambition to create an awesome workplace?**
**Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey with us to help Earth benefit from space?** 
  

  

 If you answer yes to these questions, we invite you to seize the opportunity to make a significant impact as
 **REXUS/BEXUS Program Manager** 
 in our
 **Payloads & Flight Systems** 
 team. We are looking for a dedicated teamplayerwho shares our core values of Customer passion, Care, Collaboration, Curiosity, and Courage. You will support the current program manager and share all activities and responsibilities.
   

  

 The REXUS/BEXUS program allows students from universities and higher education colleges across Europe to carry out scientific and technological experiments on sounding rockets and balloons. Each year, two rockets and two balloons are launched, carrying up to a total of 20 experiments designed and built by student teams, into space and near space. REXUS and BEXUS are launched by SSC from Esrange in Kiruna (Sweden).
   

  

**YOUR ROLE**
 As REXUS/BEXUS ( https://rexusbexus.net ) program manager at SSC, you will take part in experiment selections and key project reviews (PDRs, CDRs) for all the REXUS and BEXUS teams, focusing on aspects of electrical and software design. You will also be conducting Integration Progress Reviews and the Acceptance Reviews for the ESA/SNSA teams visiting the students at their universities (located in any ESA members state or ESA associated member state) on a regular basis, including during summertime.
   

  

 As program manager, you are also expected to become “payload manager” during the REXUS and/or BEXUS launch campaigns; meaning that you will be responsible for the experiments to be ready for integration and testing for launch as well as be the point of contact for the Esrange launch campaign manager and campaign organization. For REXUS, participation in additional activities in Germany for integration and functional testing of the payload before the campaign are included in your responsibilities.
   

  

 As program manager, you are supporting the proposal process for each financial cycle of REXUS/BEXUS and carry responsibility for the SSC budget within the program.
   

  

 Finally, the REXUS/BEXUS program has an international spirit, requiring both writing and oral English skills. In addition, the REXUS/BEXUS program is composed of 5 organizations (SNSA, DLR, ESA, ZARM and SSC), meaning that the manager shall have good communication skills to ensure good collaboration with all partners.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 To thrive in this role, we believe you:
   

  

* Have a technical background, preferably a Master of Science in engineering.
* Have strong organizational and communication skills.
* Enjoy a mix of office-based and hands-on work.
* Are independent and proactive, while also being a great collaborator with different stakeholders, such as students, colleagues, and international partners.
* Are fluent in English, both written and spoken.
* Appreciate working in an international and educational context.
* Enjoy travelling and representing SSC in meetings and student visits across Europe
* Have an interest in mentoring or teaching. Maybe you’ve even participated in REXUS/BEXUS or a similar hands-on student program?


 It’s a plus if you also have experience in electrical or software engineering and design, as these skills are valuable in many parts of the program work.
   

  

 If this sounds like you – then this could be your next adventure!
   

  

**WE OFFER YOU**
* a unique opportunity to co-manage the amazing REXUS/BEXUS program at SSC,
* a chance to work abroad with multiple partners and students from all over Europe,
* a chance to contribute to students’ education by supporting their experiment development and sharing advice and experience from yourself and the industry,
* an excellent opportunity to experience sounding rocket and stratospheric balloon launches from the historical Esrange Space Centre,
* a working experience from Sweden (Stockholm or Kiruna) while working in an international environment.


**LOCATION** 
  

  

 This is a permanent position with 40 hours/week, located at SSC Solna office (Stockholm) or Esrange Space Center (near Kiruna).
   

  

**TIMEFRAME**
 Full time position from the 1st of September 2025.
   

  

**NEXT STEP** 
  

  

 If this opportunity sparks your interest, don’t wait—apply today! Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis, and interviews will be conducted continuously.
   

  

 This is a security-classified position and will require a background check prior to employment.
   

  

**WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE**
 Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) is a leading global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. We help space organizations, research institutes, commercial and institutional actors from all over the world to get access to space.
   

  

 With local presence on all continents and about 700 committed employees, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications and satellite control services, spacecraft operations, rocket and balloon systems, launch services and flight test services, as well as engineering, operations and consultancy services for space missions.
   

  

 We help Earth benefit from Space.

title: SAP Senior Project Manager
description:
Are you looking for a global adventure in helping companies perform at their best?  Are you motivated by innovation? Are you keen to understand and optimize the underlying processes and systems that make the world's best companies run?
   

  

 If so, Westernacher has the career as a
 **Senior SAP Project Manager** 
 for you!
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain IT project plans including work breakdown structures, project milestones, critical path analyses, risk assessment and management plans, cost/benefit analyses, staffing plans, project timelines, and project budgets
* Set deadlines, assign responsibilities, and monitor and summarize the progress of projects
* Prepare project status reports for upper management
* Drive decisions to ensure the success of projects taking into account timing, risk, functional requirements, and business benefits


**Your Skills And Experience**
* More than 5 years’ experience as a Project Manager managing complex projects with SAP background
* Experience in Supply Chain Execution (EWM, TM, Yard) and/or Supply chain Planning (IBP, SAC) and/or S/4HANA as a Project Manager and/or Senior Consultant is a strong advantage
* Proficiency in Project Management methodology, project planning tools and techniques; Waterfall and Agile methodology required.
* Proficiency in Project Planning – ability to work with a project team to create a detailed project plan and resource plan from rough order of magnitude documentation
* Excellent relationship-building and networking skills and ability to function successfully in a team environment
* Excellent communication and presentation skills in Swedish and English (other languages are an advantage)
* Readiness to travel if project tasks require it


**Our Promise**
* Our great company culture: we see employees as partners and associates, not just resources
* Team Spirit  makes the difference: People working together, drawing on one another’s skills and experiences, their diversity and spiritedness
* Competitive compensation & benefits
* Individual-centric career path and growth opportunities
* Training and development opportunities
* International exposure
* Small-to-medium-sized, international, multi-disciplinary teams
* Flexible working hours and hybrid working model


**Interested? Then, don't hesitate to apply!**
**This Is WE**
 Committed to innovation, since 1969 Westernacher Consulting operates worldwide, with more than 1000 consultants in Europe, Asia and the Americas. We provide global business and SAP consulting, serving medium to large sized enterprises striving for innovation, operational excellence and profitable, sustainable growth. Headquartered in Heidelberg, Germany, Westernacher Consulting is the global leader in business process and technology innovation.
   

  

 Living, working, and operating in partnership. We are inquisitive, creative thinkers with a strong entrepreneurial spirit. We question new ways of working, think differently and are willing to try out new approaches to create value and innovation for our customers. All of this makes us pioneers in our field and keeps us responsive, quality-focused and results-oriented.
   

  

 Westernacher is a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Westernacher is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Partner Service Agent
description:
**About The Opportunity**
**Do you have a passion for delivering world-class service and a desire to grow with one of Sweden's most innovative tech companies? Look no further – we’re on the hunt for more stars to join our amazing Partner Service team!**
**In this role, your superpower is connecting with our restaurant partners with empathy and dedication, ensuring that they feel supported in every step of the way. If you are a master of verbal and written communication and love helping others, this is your chance to be part of foodora’s journey – where work meets fun!**
****YOUR MISSION****
 As a Partner Service Agent, you’ll be the go-to person for our partners, answering their questions and solving challenges via phone and email. Your responsibilities include:
   

  

* Managing tasks across multiple systems, from updating opening hours and assisting with live orders to providing technical support.
* Answering questions about invoices and menus, as well as coordinating with other departments.


**Who You Are**
* Service-Oriented - You’re passionate about delivering top-notch service and finding creative solutions.
* Communicative - A pro at collaborating with colleagues and partners and crafting clear, professional communication
* Fearless - You take initiative, embrace challenges, and learn from every experience (we’ve got your back!).
* Flexible - Juggling multiple tasks in a dynamic environment is your thing.
* Empathetic - You effortlessly understand and connect with others' needs and emotions.


 Our selection process is continuous and the ad may close before the recruitment process is completed, if we’ve moved forward to the screening or interview phase.
   

  

 Our recruitment process will include the following:
   

  

 📞 Telephone interview - Let’s cover the basics!
   

  

 💡 Psychometric tests via Alva Labs - We use science-based methodology.
   

  

 🤝 First interview - Time to know each other a bit better!
   

  

 ✔️ Reference- & background check - Final step before we’ll become colleagues.
   

  

**What you need to be successful**
 We’re looking for team players who can work 50% or 75% (with options to pick up extra shifts). foodora operates from 07:00 to 23:30 every day, so we need you to be ready to work during weekdays, evenings, weekends, and holidays.
   

  

 Your journey with us will start with a mandatory two-week introduction training, running from 11:00 to 18:00 at our office.
   

  

 We believe that you have:
   

  

* A high school diploma.
* Strong computer skills (you’ll be navigating multiple systems).
* Fluent communication skills in Swedish and English (Norwegian is a bonus!).
* Experience in service roles, like customer support or the restaurant industry.


**Who we are**
 foodora is a quick commerce and delivery company, present in eight countries in Europe - Austria, Czech, Hungary, Finland, Norway, Sweden and Slovakia. With the mission to deliver an amazing, fast and affordable experience, foodora aims to give customers more time to focus on what matters most to them, as well as growing along with their partners, riders and community along the way. foodora is part of Delivery Hero, a pioneer quick commerce company, building the next generation of e-commerce across its operations in over 70 countries across Asia, Europe, Latin America, the Middle East and Africa.
   

  

 For more information, please visit www.foodora.com
   

  

 foodora is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s leading local delivery platform operating in 70+ countries worldwide
   

  

**WHY JOIN US?**
 At foodora, no two days are the same, and that’s just how we like it! Here, you’ll find a supportive and fun-loving team, exciting challenges, and many opportunities to grow. So, are you ready to jump on board?
   

  

**What's in it for you**
* Wellness allowance topped with the opportunity to participate in many work/life balance initiatives at foodora such as free group training at Sats & reduced price on massage.
* Employee discount at foodora (woho!) and awesome friday breakfasts!
* Occupational pension, incl. premium exemption insurance, accident insurance and life insurance.
* foodora Learning - Monthly learning sessions about different topics, such as the q-commerce industry, negotiation techniques and project management combined with a structured onboarding and inspiring courses within Sana Labs.
* Great deals at Benify (for e.g. gym membership, e-bikes hotels, audiobooks, streaming services, clothes, kitchen supplies… and so much more!
* Awesome AW’s and (pink) parties!

title: Head of DevEx & DevOps
description:
**Join Our Team as a Head of DevEx & DevOps at Simployer!**
